tintangsg wrote:
>
> Hi,
> I intend to build a J2EE application using Heritrix. Could anyone
> please let me know if:
> 1. Heritrix works well in J2EE? Has anybody been building such an
> application?
>





J2EE is a broad spectrum of technologies.  What in particular are you 
looking for?

Out on our continuous build server, 
http://builds.archive.org:8080/cruisecontrol/artifacts/HEAD-heritrix/20061120234211/, 
it packaged as a WAR.  Spotty reports from the list would indicate 
Heritrix basically works packaged so.  In the past, I've played w/ 
packaging Heritrix as a SAR.  On deploy to a J2EE container, Heritrix 
registered itself with the container's JNDI and JMX Agent services and 
deployed its UI.

> 2. Heritrix is stable in a multi-threading environment?
>


Yes.

If you are planning on integrating Heritrix, this page (written by 
Shifra Raffel) may be of help: 
http://crawler.archive.org/cgi-bin/wiki.pl?EmbeddingHeritrix.

St.Ack



>
> Your reply will be much appeciated!
>
>
